visualization_prompt: Generate an interactive map chart showing geographic points of interest using Highmaps with OpenStreetMap baselayer and custom navigation controls
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains geospatial coordinates (latitude/longitude pairs) representing points of interest. The base layer uses OpenStreetMap's tiled web service for geographic context. Synthetic coordinates were generated around the initial focal point (μ=6.5811, σ=0.002 longitude) to demonstrate clustering. The visualization employs Tufte's data-ink ratio by keeping base map details minimal while highlighting POIs with contrasting markers. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through proportional symbol sizing and strategic label placement. The interactive navigation controls maintain focus on the primary data layer while allowing exploration of the geographic context.
